Reviews.Title: “Decent at best”
Reviews.Author: kylelsim
Reviews.Content: The location is really quite out of the way. Price wise is alright but to this hotel really needs to use things like free WIFI to entice customers to stay with them. In this day and age WIFI really is as important as a working shower. That aside, I'd skip the hotel breakfast and grab some fruits at the fruttieria 2mins away or eat at the university cafeteria that is right next door. they sell cheap water as well. The only plus point from staying in the Basilica S. paolo neighborhood is the very relaxed atmosphere, also good is that you pass by Piramide metro station on the way back from central Rome and there is an abundance of good food in the Testaccio vicinity. Da Felice, Augustrello, Da Bucatino and Volpetti for their deli goods. The room is alright, clean and functional, water is nice and hot and decent sized. Reception though as one other reviewer mentioned is quite dreadful. Studied my passport longer than it took customs to stamp it. All in all avoid this hotel if possible, you can get other hotels at similar prices in better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, for its price you can easily find better”
Reviews.Author: kmorwath
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel. It is expensive, but you get only a small room with cheap and low-quality furniture (they call it "minimalistic!). Parquet on the floor, but with clear scratches on it. TV was still a huge cheap old model (no flat screen here). Shower doors didn't close well so water escaped on the floor. Small lavatory in a corner, no light over the mirror. At €150 breakfast and wifi access had to be paid separately. Thin windows glass, noise outside isn't kept out. Early morning rubbish collection awoke me this moring. And this morning the corridor was filled with a greasy taste coming from who knows where - not the smell you'd like to meet when you leave the room. At that price you can easily find better, even in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: tacoSEVEN
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that this hotel is WAY off the beaten path. In fact, we kind of got lost trying to find it as we were roaming neighborhoods well outside the tourist hotspots. Also, it is about a 10 min walk from the closest metro. Oh, and it wasn't just us lost. Locals near the station weren't even aware of it so it really wasn't big by any means. All that said, once we found it and got settled in we were pretty happy. It's a nice walk to/from the metro once you know where you are headed. I kind of liked the charm of being in a quite part of town and just seeing people roaming about their normal day-to-day lives. Also, the hotel is cute, but very small. Nothing too fantastic really, pretty standard, but it was clean and I knew what I was getting into for the price/other reviews. This seems best suited for students or couples like us that don't mind staying a little out of the main areas to save some money(so you can spend it on more meaningful things of course).

Reviews.Title: “A basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArunGupta
Reviews.Content: A very minimal hotel No restaurant or room service No fitness center No complimentary wifi Staff seems to have an attitude Shower is *really* small, literally elbow space only. Drain pipe would get clogged and will take a while to clean up. Most likely would not stay with a family here, prefer a hotel with a restaurant/room service at least. There are no tourist spots near by the hotel as well. The nearest ATM machine is also about 0.5 km.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skeldergate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel St Paul for three nights (Wednesday, Thursday & Friday nights). We arrived at Roma Termini railway station. From there it was a Metro ride (about 15-20 minutes) to Basillica San Paulo and from there a ten minute walk to the hotel. Check-in was good and the man at reception spoke good English and gave us a fantastic tourist map of Rome and highlighted the main tourist sites. We found that this map was more helpful than the guidebook that we had purchased before leaving home ! Our room was clean and located on the top floor (the 5th). The complaints we have about the room are 1) 1 pillow per person. This was quite flat and an additional pillow would have been welcome. 2) The hot air heater was sometimes not sufficient to keep the room warm. It was a choice of either having a noisy heater on all night or allowing the room to become somewhat chilly. I suppose, with hindsight, we should have asked for a blacket and extra pillows. Brekfast was very good. Lots of choice. Ham, cheese, eggs (hard boiled and scrambled) and sausages (hot dog type). Tea, coffee, lots of fresh fruit. Cakes, biscuits and much more ! Wi-Fi is in the hotel but is chargeable. There's a computer in the reception area that guests may use the internet free of charge - however they suggest no more than 15 minutes of use to allow other guest to access the service. Sadly our last night was spoilt by loud noises made a bunch of alcohol induced neandrathal idiots who found it extremely amusing to arrive back at the hotel at 3am. Not the hotels fault - but a blot on an otherwise peaceful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: clau08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Although it is not centrally located it is only a 10 minutes' walk to the metro station Basilica S. Paolo and the area is a quiet one. The rooms and bathrooms are big and very clean and the only things that bothered me were the fact that the wireless internet was not free of charge and that they didn't provide slippers and there was no carpet on the floor. Good buffet breakfast with a wide range of choices. I wouldn't rate it as a 4 star hotel (as the rooms don't have coffee/tea making facilities and the toiletries in the bathroom were basic) I'd rather say it is a good 3 star hotel. Overall it's a good value for money and I'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all”
Reviews.Author: gmgh
Reviews.Content: Bad parts: * Really cold room, despite the thermostat set to maximum level. * I have been assigned to a room with handicap equipped bathroom, with big diseases for showers. * Bed not comfortable. * No way to completely prevent light from coming into the room. Good parts: * Good breakfast at 4 euros

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Keysersoze007
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here in September 2011 for 5 nights. It is a great value for money hotel we have stayed in Europe till date. The rooms have a big double bed and an AC that works (much needed in Rome). The bathrooms are fairly big and super clean. The bed linen was changed alternate days. The hotel staff were friendly at arrival and helped us figure out our way first couple of days. The breakfast is really good, and us being vegetarians, we were surprised to see the good spread as well. Closest metro is about a kilometer, which I would say is the only negative I would say.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great place to stay for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Helen L
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews we had seen on Trip Advisor, and we weren't disappointed. For three nights bed and breakfast it was very reasonably priced (including flights we paid £224 each for the holiday). It is based in the south of Rome, and you will need to get the metro to the centre of Rome, however the Metro is only about a ten minute walk (if that) and trains are very frequent. The Colosseum is only four stops away, and we found that from here you could walk to the majority of sites from here. However I would recommend buying a Roma pass for €25 which gives you 3 days free transport on all of the transport in Rome, as well as free entry to two museums or archaeological sites, and discounted entry after that. As we used ours for entry to the Colosseum and Roman Forum (which are €12 each) and used the metro about four times a day, we saved a lot of money with the Roma pass! As for the rooms in the hotel, they were very small, but there was everything you needed, including a large double bed (which is probably why the room seemed so small!) it was a clean, well decorated room, but to be honest all we needed was a bed, as most of the day was spent out exploring the city! The breakfast in the hotel was also very nice, and the staff were really friendly and helpful. Overall the we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “horrendous”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Saint Paul for 5 days.We were shocked at the appearence of the rooms. The first room offered had peeling floor tiles,abroken toilet seat .We were given another choice but it wasn,t much better. The bed springs were poking up and we had to ask for a mattress pad to be able to sleep. One afternoon after a tiring day in Rome we came back and found no toilet tissue at all in the room, I had to go to the lobby and retrieve it myself.The hotel is billed as a 4 star but it,s barely a 1 star.The whole effect was a rundown second rate hotel. Evelyn from Connecticut.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good Hotel and Exceptional service-despite some of the reviews here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShamW
Reviews.Content: Right let me start of by telling you how hard it was to find this little gem amongst the rubbish available in Rome!!! Hotels and b&bs in the centre of Rome tend to be overpriced and generally of a terrible quality. I read an extensive range of online Roman hotel reviews and from recommendations from Italian friends, Hotel Saint Paul seemed like an excellent option. …. And boy was I happy with my selection! The hotel itself is around 8-10 mins walk from Basilica San Paolo station. When you have been walking around the entire city all day a short walk to the hotel from the station will not be an issue despite some reviews on this site. The station is also relevantly placed on Line B which during the engineering works (till 2012) remains open till late. The Hotel is situated in a quiet residential area close to the University, The area is not rough or dodgy, it just has the inner city charm that most residential areas do. There are a range of amenities close to the station including coffee shops, restaurants and Internet cafes. When looking for places to stay, I also recommend looking in the areas of Piarmide, San Paolo or Maglianne all on Line B and a max of 6 stops from the centre! The hotel is clean, tidy, and modern and feels really fresh. The hotel staffs were exceptionally professionally, helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet has a huge selection of continental food to set you up for the day, and on a Saturday served till 11am. The rooms are clean and tidy, could be a little more spacious (but you are in the middle of a inner city tower block). The only few down sides were the one single small window, so use this as an excuse to get out the room and explore the city! My partner and I were sharing two twin beds joined together, which during the night would shuffle apart. The TV channels only show Italian TV, again another excuse to get out and see Rome. But my biggest issue was with the no free WIFI, this should be a standard not an addition to the price, cause European data costs a lot!!!! All in all perfect hotel for a long weekend in Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the beginning of September. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly members of staff who were very helpful and when we had any questions, they were willing to help by offering maps and giving us directions to the nearest metro station. We had problems with payment issues before our trip had even started and we received an email from the hotel. This was all sorted in a very professional and friendly manner. The hotel was clean and modern with towels and sheets being changed daily. Our room was on the small side, but as we were in the city for sightseeing this wasn’t too much of a problem. The metro was only a 10 minute walk away and it didn’t take long to get into the city, however the area didn’t feel the safest at night time with men and prostitutes hanging about on the main road, and being two female travellers we felt pressured to leave the city early so we didn’t have to walk back late at night. Overall the hotel was good and had everything you needed, and for the price we paid it was really value for money. If I was to return to Rome, I would probably spend a bit more so I could stay in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: GregElsa
Reviews.Content: This was a real value for money hotel... (4 beds room). The 10 minutes walk form the metro station was ok in the morning but seemed far away when we came back at night. This is not an easy hotel to reach back and relax at noon and go back to Rome (we did it only once). It is a 30 minute distance with the bus which is 1 minute from the hotel (Nr. 170). One big problem are the prostitudes waiting for clients at night at the main road (Viale Marconi), so be careful when coming back... get down at the first bus stop after crossing the river... you will feel safer. We were a family of 4 and got down on the wrong stop!!... but we walked away quickly... there was no danger... only a small lack of safety, but I am sure that this was just a feeling, not real! At the front desk everyone was very helpful... oh and ask for a room at least at level 1 or more, not level 0 where the receprion is... level 0 is -2m. from the ground and has 4 rooms!.... Room was very clean, towels change every day. The university was closed at the days of our visit, so I dont know about the noise other people noticed! Ask the staff to help you with the buses... there is a direct bus to pz. Venecia (170), also one to Vatican and Castello St.Angelo (takes ages to come) and we took one back at night from Transtevere to out metro station which was convenient! We might fo back at this hotel... the price was really good, but also might prefer a hotel near to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern hotel, but a fair distance from the city centre”
Reviews.Author: mallowpuff_nz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Paul Hotel at the end of August for 5 nights. The hotel itself is clean and modern with good staff, who appeared more professional than friendly. Otherwise very helpful with directions into town and bus routes etc. Our room was a good size, but the bathroom was a bit small. The TV in our room didn't work properly -there were pink areas in the picture, and the remote control had seen better days as parts of it had been taped together. Overall, our stay was enjoyable and we found this hotel was good value for money. We didn't eat breakfast there, so no comments on that. The only problem we had with St Paul Hotel was the location of it. We knew it was located outside the city centre, but we had assumed it was close to a metro station. It was a good 15 minute walk from the metro station to the hotel, and in a sketchy neighbourhood. The first night we walked back from the metro station at about 11:30pm and there weren't many cars around the station as its not on a main road. When we got to main road we passed a hooker, and later a couple of men just hanging around the streets. For the remaining nights we had no problems as we took the number 170 bus back to the hotel at night, which took about half an hour from Capitaline museum. The bus dropped us off on the main road, and then it was about a 5 min walk to the hotel. The 170 bus also leaves from Termini and the Colosseum, roughly every 20 or 30 minutes. Being first time visitors to Rome it was hard to work out the bus schedules as we couldn't find a bus timetable, and even more difficult to locate the correct bus stop for the bus number. Next time we would be prepared to pay a little more for accommodation closer to the city centre as we found it too inconvenient trying to catch buses all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Sonya & Rachel. We loved it and would rate it as one of the best places we stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: sonya1971
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was a very clean and friendly place. Any enquires was not a problem with the reception staff, they were very helpfull with directions etc. We would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but distant from City Centre....”
Reviews.Author: TaraLynnC
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well kept and spotless, excellent breakfast and friendly staff. Rooms were typically small but nicely furnished. Minor issues that we had that we could have avoided: Internet service is available in room but very expensive, hotel was quite far from Roma Ostiense train station and even further from city centre and no iron or ironing room - actually went out and spent 10 Euros on an iron for a few days and left it there. We wound up leaving early to go back towards French Riviera and hotel would not accept reservation cancellation despite 3 days advance notice which did not seem right - we paid for 3 extra nights that we did not stay there. Overall good value but be aware of small inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: jaxman3
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in, the front desk staff was wonderful. Our bags did not make it with our flight and they helped us work with the airline to get them delivered to the hotel. Everyone working there was so friendly (the front desk staff spoke English), they even sat down with us and helped us figure out how to get to all of the locations we wanted to see. The hotel is an easy 10-12 min walk to the Metro, which will take you to all of the tourist hot spots. We didn't have a vehicle, we used the Metro to get everywhere. There was a lot of graffiti in the erea, but we never felt in danger. There is a Trattorias right across the street that had some of the best food we ate on our trip. The free breakfast was amazing!! And you CANNOT beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money but quite noisy...”
Reviews.Author: Kaja_IV
Reviews.Content: We did classic weekend trip to Rome with my wife and I wanted to have reasonably priced nice hotel not very far from the centre. Based on the reviews on this site I chose Saint Paul as it received quite high ranking among 4 stars. I cannot compare to other hotels in Rome but here what I liked and disliked: Liked: - clean hotel - nice bathroom - helpful staff - very nice breakfast - convenient location (my view) - price Dislike: - tiny room (for Rome standards it might be big...) - room facing to the backyard with very noisy device (big air condition?) and the lively restaurant - recommend to avoid those rooms (need to say that I have not asked to change the room) - not fitting "paperdoors" so everything is heard - quite far from the centre (my wife view when returning from the centre in the night) Because of noisy room I would choose another hotel next time. Definitely not 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “we like it”
Reviews.Author: davidthebest
Reviews.Content: we like the metro is verry near we find everything is well to visit rome breakfast is nice

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: londre_11
Reviews.Content: Good staff nice breakfast and the hotel near the metro station....i love roma

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JimmyFareham
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are small however, spotlessly clean. Hotel staff were without exception helpfull, polite and could not do enough for you. Asked to change rooms for one with a small balcony no issues! We left for the day returned and all our cases had been delivered to the new room. We did purchase breakfast in our deal yet again clean and plenty of it (continental Breakfast with bacon scrambled eggs included). The only downside is the location it is 4 stops from the centre of the city and a 10 minute walk to the metro. The area is quite safe and we never felt threatened however, if you like graffiti then Rome is the place for you!! We would go back to this hotel but if you are after the hustle and bustle of the centre this one will not be for you!!

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: yushiiix
Reviews.Content: we are very happy during our visit to rome and we find the staff of the reception very helpful mr rachid was kindly to explain us everything . we will comeback.

Reviews.Title: “exellent”
Reviews.Author: badro_rock
Reviews.Content: the hotel is clean and also we are very happy of nice breakfast and the staff during our cheek in was fantastic and the metro was near so we will camback and recomend your hotel to our freinds .

Reviews.Title: “Ask Abdellah”
Reviews.Author: EliInverness
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal through a travel website, and therefore it was excellent value for money, even though as another review stated the room was a lot smaller than the photos make it out to be. However, it was clean, tidy, and the cleaner(s) changed the towels and topped up any bathroom supply (soap bars, tissues and shower caps) on a daily basis. Staff as per previous reviews were always helpful, but not always that knowledgeable. Abdellah, however was a star: always smiling and willing to help, even when his shift had already finished and I couldn't access the internet. On arriving at the hotel he gave us a "Rome induction", providing us with maps of the main touristic area, and giving us options in terms of transportation, as well as highlighting on the map how to get to the main attractions. The hotel is next to a cafe/restaurant, which had a couple of night events during the week we were there. We were on the top floor, so the music didn't bother us too much, but this is something to be mindful of if your room is on a lower floor, and your window opens to that side of the hotel. Other than that, transport is easy and frequent, and it was good to be off the beaten track. I'd go back tomorrow if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre Incompetence”
Reviews.Author: LGWATL
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because I had business in the area. Very basic room but clean. Unfortunately they failed completely on service. I had an early flight and they promised to arrange a taxi, but forgot. They promised to make a dinner reservation and forgot. They have a bizarre process for wireless access that requires you to purchase a usage card. I wanted a €10 for 3 hours, but they only seem to have 24 hour cards. I insisted on 3 hours and, guess what – they found one. When I tried to use it, it didn’t work. When I called the front desk, they didn’t answer after multiple attempts, forcing me to go back downstairs and sort it out face-to-face. When I checked out the next morning the utterly incompetent front desk clerk didn’t know how to charge for the wireless access or the beers we had in the bar the night before (the room itself had been pre-paid via Expedia). I know this sounds unbelievable but it is true. He spent a full 15 minutes on the phone with someone trying to sort out how to charge us. We finally had to walk out. I can forgive a couple of minor mistakes but this place seems to be run by people who sincerely don’t know what they’re doing, or they don’t care.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great stay”
Reviews.Author: J0_mc
Reviews.Content: - Service was frendly, helpful and always available. - Our double bedroom was basic and small-ish, but modern, cleaned daily, airconditoned (you can control the temp), equipped with enough furniture, comfortable, and quiet. Came with a small balcony. Safe also present in room. - Ensuite bathroom very spacious, very clean, very good shower facility. - Excellent continental breakfast available, all you can eat of everything. - Hotel is located 5 traiin stops from the centre of Rome and tourist areas (10min ride). Trains every 10mins, but beware trains stop running at 11.30pm on weeknights, 12.30 weekends. Long walk from the city. Station is a 10min walk from the hotel. Supermarket, cafes, restaurants, laundromat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Veyka
Reviews.Content: It was overall peaceful except for some party people on one night. The neighbourhood seems safe and quiet, and the fabulous San Paulo Fuori le Mura cathedral is very close by (it's very beautiful church and has only fraction of the amount of tourists other churches in the city receive). You can reach the hotel easily by metro line, and the walk is actually rather scenic, but after a long day of sightseeing the walk back to hotel from the metro station felt a bit long... So, could be closer to metro station. But the price is hard to beat for this type of hotel, rooms are clean and nice and the breakfast has a good selection of different foods. Still, the biggest plus for the hotel, in addition to the competitive price, are the staff. One of the guys working on the front desk deserves a special thank you for being super helpful on all matters. We had several (not hotel related) problems during our stay in Rome and he really helped to save our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTriad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in the best and the worst hotels. This has to be the worst. I never expected a 4 star hotel to have a shower which floods the bathroom with every use. I never expected a 4 star hotel to have water damage on the floor of the bedroom either. The television was a leftover from the early 90s and had no english stations. The hotel advertises that it is air conditioned, but, they do not turn the air conditioner units on during certain months. (After complaining the unit was turned on) The area the hotel is located is less than glamerous. Basically a neighborhood for the working class of Rome. Don't waste your money like I did. Stay somewhere near some of the major attractions in Rome or you will probably be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Received a good deal through a last...”
Reviews.Author: BigtimeGB
Reviews.Content: Received a good deal through a last minute website and was very impressed with the pictures online. I paid around £300.00 for 3 nights for a double which seemed very competitive compared to other hotels on the area. The positives are that the location is fantastic, only 5 mins walk from nearest station which gets you anywhere within a few mins. Also the Colissium is only a 10 min walk. Another positive is that the staff at the hotel are great. Very helpful and provide very sound advice for local attractions, bars, restaurants etc. Negatives are that the street is very noisey with a public swimming pool adjacent and a school. This meant very early wake up calls, around 730am, from all all sides of the hotel. The hallways in the hotel are very noisey and I woke up every morning with a bang at 7am! Went back to sleep then the screaming kids commenced shouting at 730-745. If I had wanted an early night and watched the LCD tv with sky, this was not possible as it dd not work for nearly 2 days. Also there was no welcome pack or room service! Also the breakfast, which was not included would have been an additional €90 for 2 (for the 3 days). Not too bad however the spread was nothing compared to Irish/English. The staff did however very kindly arrange for a coffee. Around 6/10 but you may really like it if you dont mind kids, the location really is fantastic and it all looks very nice. Cheers Big Time London

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ChipF
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I have with the hotel was that they don't have "Free" internet. You can share the computer in the lobby with other guests but for internet access on your own you have to pay for it. The other thing was that our booking did not include free breakfast and it was not indicated in our tour package. Other than that, the place is extremely clean, the staff is helpful and knowlegable about the area, sweet location if you don't mind a little walking, and quiet. All in all a great hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: silentboo
Reviews.Content: Smallish but nice room in a nicely decorated hotel. Nice enough breakfast and I liked the location. Some Italien rockband were staying there, they left loads of magazines around the bar with them on te front cover- made me smile.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value. Very Good Service."”
Reviews.Author: ANPNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Saint Paul Hotel from November 3-9, 2009. Room was clean and nicely furnished. Hotel staff were multilingual, friendly and quite helpful. The walk to the metro takes about 7 or 8 minutes. The walk to the bus stop is less than five minutes. The hotel itself is near Basilica San Paolo (which is spectacular inside), but that is about it as far as tourist attractions are concerned. We were satisfied with the location because we didn't want to be in the middle of tourist central. There aren't many restaurant choices in the area, but we found two good trattorias: one at the hotel's suggestion and one on out own. If you are looking for more elegant dining options, you will have to look elsewhere. The only thing negative thing about the Saint Paul Hotel was the room on the first floor right behind the lobby. DO NOT STAY IN THIS ROOM. It seems designed for either disabled or elderly people. The shower practically flooded the bathroom when used. Since the room was right behind the lobby and kitchen, we could hear every sound.It was raining when we arrived and you could hear the water cascading down. It was awful. However, when we complained the hotel moved us the following day to a really nice room on the fifth floor. Everything was fine from that point forward. The staff didn't give us the slightest difficulty about moving. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be Fooled”
Reviews.Author: SVacation
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the pictures supplied by the hotel. This hotel is not a good pick. My husband and I stayed here on the last two nights of our 8-day vacation in Italy. We were well aquainted with small European rooms, strange bathroom layouts and hotel locations that were unappealing...but this one took the cake! The hotel is located in a ugly part of town with almost no options for restaurants or groceries. The hotel staff is polite but not helpful at all. One of them told us to take a 2 hour bus ride to the Vatican, when it only took 30 min by metro and was less expensive. The rooms look nothing like the pictures. They look like unfurnished dorm rooms with a bed, a table, and a TV only. Also, I don't have a problem with walking at all while on vacation, but the closet metro stop was at least 15 min away and you had to walk through some shady neighborhoods to get there. All in all, this is not worth any money you think you might be saving to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to get back after a day walking Rome.”
Reviews.Author: mikjayfay
Reviews.Content: Apart from an hiccup the first night when we were put in a ground floor room which was obviously fitted for disable guests with wheelchair access for the shower,We asked to move because the shower flooded the bathroom and we had to mop up everytime we used the shower..we found this hard work as abled bodied people so heaven help someone in a wheel chair! Still very good show for the Hotel because at least they are trying to make it accessable to everyone. they just need to shoot the guy who fitted the shower! We were moved up to the top(5th) floor and this room was much better, small but what we expected after staying in other Italian hotels, Both rooms were spotlessly clean and were cleaned daily with fresh towels,soap etc. The english speaking reception staff were lovely and friendly sorting any problems out and a great help with travel tips and booking a gallery visit for us Breakfast... very important start to the day...a good selection of everything for a nice hot or cold breakfast and a lovely lady keeping an eye on your every need...or maybe making sure you don't flog the cutlery! The area was a little bit rough outside(but that could be just me) but we had no problems walking home late and during the day. The Metro is ten minutes walk away but after walking around Rome all day that ten minute walk seemed to get longer and longer every time we did it...sore feet!

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Texasbug
Reviews.Content: Quiet little hotel 10 minutes from metro. Small but extremely clean rooms with a/c. Hotel offers free internet access in the lobby as well as a bar that serves drinks and snacks. The breakfast buffet provided each morning more than makes up for any shortcomings the hotel may have. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel- but very small rooms and 10 min walk from Metro”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler4227
Reviews.Content: St. Paul Hotel was a decent price, however, the rooms were really small and you don't have control of your A/C unit in your room. The hotel has one main A/C unit and its the same throughout the hotel, so we weren't able to make it any cooler in our room. It was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel to the Metro train station. The walk wasn't too bad if you don't mind walking. You're going to be walking a lot in Rome, anyways. The breakfast every morning was pretty good- scrambled eggs and meats, bread, cheese- and good cappucinos.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: C_MLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great value if you are simply looking for a base to explore Rome from. Whilst it's not in the centre of Rome, it's in a quiet area and is only a 10 minute walk away from the metro & there are two bus stops close by that will take you to the Vatican (128) or the centre of town (170) which we used more than the metro. Whilst the rooms are quite small, if you are only using the hotel as a base, you cannot fault them as they're clean and modern. The breakfast buffet is great - enough range for everyone and no reason to leave hungry for a day exploring!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: curerosie
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the rooms were spotless - small, yes, but I was travelling alone and just wanted somewhere comfy, clean and safe to spend my few days in Rome. It excelled in all of these and the breakfast was fresh and varied as you like. On the second night there I took an allergic reaction and was very ill all night and after taking antihistemine got really panicky and upset and scared, as I was all alone in a strange city! The staff were unbelievably attentive. They checked on me regularly to make sure I was okay, both by phone and in person until I the medication had taken effect and I could settle down for the night, calmed me down and assured me they could get a doctor at any time I wanted one. They calmed me down so much and reassured me during what was extremely scary - I have had anyphylactic reactions before where my throat has closed over. Because I didn't speak italian, needless to say I terrified myself but they dealt with it so well! Rome is beautiful and not somewhere you want to sit in your hotel all day and night but the rooms were clean, fresh and airy so were great for chilling out with a book when finished trekking round the sights all day! Can't stress how grateful I am to the people who worked there, and how well they did their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: KimmyCustard
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel and took me to Rome for my birthday as he knew I'd always wanted to go. The hotel is about 15 mins outside the centre of Rome, but the Metro is 5 mins walk away. Our room was small but perfectly formed, comfy bed, fully equipped bathroom and shower and very clean. We were on the 4th floor and there was no noise, from other guests or outside. Breakfast was included on a buffet system, very tasty and freshly made every morning. The area felt safe and just opposite a University so lots of people around. Rome was beautiful but expensive, although well worth the 3 nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandyCoLouth
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, it's a nice hotel, the staff are friendly and the place is spotless, we found our room to be very small, and the shower well that was a puzzle it had the wierdest shower screen i ever seen, it covered half your body and had no ceilent on it, so every time we had a shower the bathroom was flooded that relly annoyed me... but apart from that the hotel was fine it had eveything we needed, its a bit out of the way from the sites but the taxi's are a reasonable price so we didn't mind that, plus it's good after a long day site seeing to go back to a quiet area... i would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to rome site seeing....

Reviews.Title: “Modern and confortable!”
Reviews.Author: crazymel
Reviews.Content: i was in two minds about booking this review due to some negative feedback i found on the net, but i found a good deal and booked it anyway and i am so glad i did!the hotel is tucked away just off a main road opposite Rom's 3rd university so parking at weekends is not a problem at all, although hotel suggest leaving it in the road at the side of the hotel as it is more residential (or you can park in a private car park just down the road).hotel is modern and extremely clean. i booked the ''romance'' option and although we booked a double we got a triple room, found bath robes and slippers and a rose on the bed. 15 min after we got in we hav a bottle of bubbly and a plate with chocolates on ....also this ''romance'' offer allowed us to have a late check out... 2pm instead of 12 which is always nice! staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful!room and bathroom are in perfect condition and very nice!we asked where we could go for something to eat and they advised us on this restaurant we were picked up from the hotel and taken back once we had finished our meal..meal was lovely and placce and owners were v nice too..avarage price for nice food in rome! pros: perfect if you are coming to rome by car and don't want to do the touristy things breakfast is fab there is everything even boiled eggs and toast! location is literally 10min walking distance to the metro stop and metro closes at midnight. free internet in lobby cons the lift.... a new lift has been put in and they expect to have it working in ab 10 days... so by beg dec 07. would def go there again !

Reviews.Title: “everything was fine, but...”
Reviews.Author: mark294
Reviews.Content: Nice, renovated hotel 4-5 metro stops away from center. the only negative is that they made us go up to the 6th floot without elevator. elevator is under construction... if you don't mind to execise it is good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: Nellula
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Saint Paul in february, and the reason we chose it was because I had read the positive reviews from Tripadvisor. I'm glad I did! The hotel was very clean, the staff were great, very friendly and helpful. Our room was quite small but tidy. Lovely bathroom! Breakfast was very good, fresh fruit etc. Only negative thing: our bed could have been softer. Very well worth our money this place, not too expensive! Jaana from Finland

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine but a little out of the way...”
Reviews.Author: Angelina1477
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for three nights in March, and overall it was a postive experience. The hotel has a just-renovated feel and everything is sleek and minimalist. The staff were friendly and the rooms were spotlessly clean, if a little small. The breakfast was also fine with a good selection of cereal, breads, fruit etc provided. My only real problem was the location. The hotel is tucked away off a main road - about 10-15 minutes walk from San Paolo metro station - and the neighbourhood, although perfectly safe, struck me as a bit dour and lifeless. There are no bars or shops around (although the receptionist did recommend a local restaurant on our last night which was excellent and good value for money). If you are going to Rome for the first time or for a short trip I would definitely recommend spending a bit more money and staying somewhere more central and closer to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel St. Paul”
Reviews.Author: DanielTelAviv
Reviews.Content: We stayed inn the hotel in the begining of April, 2007. The pros: 1. The hotel is actually renewed, ordinary, 5-6 floors, building adopted for the hotel; the rooms are new and clean. 2. 10-15 minutes walk to the metro; 3. Lower than usual level of city noise; 4. Helpful staff; 5. Breakfast: non-continental, with a good level of meals choice; The cons: 1. Rooms are small, while the bathroom is big, without the bath itsalf (duche only); 2. Our room was on the 1st floor and the parking just under the windows is a little bit bothering (not mentioning the level of robberies in the city. A thief can merely jump into the room...). Ask for, at least, 2nd floor. 3. There isn't special stage for the bag. We had to put the bag into the closet and to manage it there.... 4. The elevator doesn't stop when "caught" during the motion. You have to wait until it is free, or to go by your own....In ddition, the elevator door isn't equipped with "ammortization" sytem: if you leave it free, you get quite a "kaboom" just behind your back...

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: marrowDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic trip to Rome. After reading all the reviews on Saint Paul, felt we needed to just point out that it is quite a bit further out of Rome than we had expected. It was a 10 minute walk to the metro and then about 20 minutes on the metro. The bus took about 40 minutes to get into the city. The walk from the metro to the hotel can be a bit scary late at night. The hotel is very clean, room was fairly small, but that was not a problem. Breakfast was excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Be very careful on the metro - my husband had his wallet stolen on our first night!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, good value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Deb&JohnOxford
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel with good breakfast and friendly staff. They also have free internet access. A little hard to find, if you are not familiar with the vicinity. Do use the San Paolo Metro station and walk to the hotel (10 min - see previous review). As an alternative method of transport, use the busses (no. 170 to Termini and no. 23 to the Vatican). You can see so much more of the city. Get a city map with bus routes on it!! Only dislike were the narrow and hard beds. It is okay for a few nights though.

Reviews.Title: “A great place in a great city”
Reviews.Author: jackdanieluk
Reviews.Content: Little out of town but would definately use again. An excellent clean and welcoming hotel, roomy with great modern spotless bathroom. A ten minute walk to Sao Paolo Metro Station and then a ten minute ride to the city. Metro trains efficient and cheap. We bought a 3 day ticket for 11 euros, great value. To get to the Hotel Saint Paul. Leave the Metro Sao Paolo station and walk out across the Via Ostiense ( which goes past the Cathedral Sao Paolo ). Walk up the Via Colossi straight up for about ten minutes until you reach the very busy Via Marconi. There is a bar and a row of shops on the corner, walk across Via Marconi . Walk Left , then take your first right there is a factory on the corner and the hotel is 2 minutes further on. Enjoy your stay The breakfast is worth the stay alone !

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short break”
Reviews.Author: StewpotLeeds
Reviews.Content: I hope to give you an honest summary of this hotel and a few hints on Rome to make your stay enjoyable and hassle free. From Ciampino you have a few options of getting to the city and hotel. The best option we found was to take the direct shuttle bus service (€5) to Termini station (45 mins). The metro in Rome is basic but easy to follow as there are only 2 lines (A & B). Make sure to take the B line (blue) heading to Laurentina and get off at Marconi (15 mins). Tickets cost €1 for 75 mins, €4 for a day pass and €11 for 3 days. On exiting the metro station turn right and walk for 10 mins along the main road. The hotel is down a side street on the left just before the university block. Firstly the positives: Rooms are small but very clean with a great bathroom and shower. Small balcony with views of the west of Rome. Safe, mini bar and basic channel TV. Staff very helpful. Breakfast more than adequate. Negatives: Some may find the location a problem, we didn't. Also there are only a few snack bars nearby so eat in Rome. That's it! In all the hotel makes a great base to get into Rome explore this great city and come away from the hustle of a large city, recharge and do it all again the next day. For the price we paid it was certainly value for money and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “first time in rome”
Reviews.Author: louiseg32
Reviews.Content: arrived home last night, after a weekend staying at this hotel. the hotel was very nice, beautiful breakfasts, very clean, very helpful staff, friendly alround. the hotel was a little far out, although there is a bus 170 staight to termini station, metro was a little to far for easy walking, if you arrive at night, the journey from the metro, to hotel is quite scary, we felt a bit alone. take a taxi if you do. or get the 170 bus, from station, get of the first stop after marconi bridge. rome was very busy, we enjoyed the flea market on sunday at porta portese, well worth a visit. the stop and go tour buses are the best way to see rome. i would prefer to stay very central if i was visiting again, shame about location, would stay at hotel again, VALUE for your money. more central hotels cost sooooooooo much more, so if on a budget visit here and buy a 3 day bus, metro ticket...................... enjoy yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, clean clean”
Reviews.Author: Skinner71
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a wedding last month - was listed as a 4* but in reality it was a good 2 star or standard 3 star at best Having said that it wasn't alltogether unpleasant. The room was fairly cramped and basic but did the job for one person and it was absolutely spotless - cleanest hotel I stayed in so hats off to the domestic staff - laundry service was excellent and staff couldn't do enough for you in general - free internet access in the lobby and the breakfast buffet was excellent (except for the dodgy coffee (sacreligeous in Italy I would have thought!) Was a little bit out of town which suited me cause it took you away from the madness that is Rome city centre - plus the tube was only a 10 minute walk and only 2 stops to the Colloseum so no big deal in my opinion Overall impressions were good and its on the right side of town from LdV airport - I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “some good points, but probably not rushing back”
Reviews.Author: wanderer007
Reviews.Content: Okay, where to start? The reviews on trip advisor, expedia etc were mixed (when aren't they), but overall positive; personally, I'd say the hotel was adequate, but not one that you'd have especially fond memories of. The location is 'interesting'; in among universtity buildings, there is a convenience store, basic-looking restaurant and a tyre and battery store(!) just across the main road, but not much else. For ATMs, bars/cafes, shops etc, the nearest are at St Pauls Basilica. This also the location of the nearest metro station. The walk between the hotel and metro/shops is between 5 and 10 minutes and along mainly residential type roads. We felt perfectly safe and unthreatened doing this walk at midnight, but I guess it depends on your own perspective/experiences. Trains from St Pauls are frequent, cost a euro and take about ten minutes to the colosseum metro station (Metro line B). The hotel itself is not what I would call 4*. It is more like a good 3*. Positives first; the staff were really good and very helpful. The bedrooms and bathrooms were very clean. Good showers, firm beds, nice towels, sheets etc. Generous breakfasts catering to most reasonable needs (although the coffee 'vending machine' was a bit naff). The negatives; the rooms? The first one we had was very small with a powerful smell of masked smoke. I asked if there was a room with more space and they changed it for us the next day without problems. The snag was we returned to a much larger room with no smell, but also very little light as it had only a tiny window!! I could/should have complained again, but just resigned myself to what we had. Looking at the floor plans, my guess is that the hotel has more 'duff' rooms than 'good' ones. There are three at the front on each of the five floors that have balconies, and althought they probably wouldn't have spectacular views, I am sure that if you had one of these your stay would be much more enjoyable. The other main snag with the hotel and what I think makes it more of a 3* was the lack of facilities; there is a small bar/coffee bar in the reception area, but no lounge, no restaurant, no outdoor area/terrace etc (unless you include the one bench outside the front door!). The problem with this of course is that if you do get one of the dodgy rooms, and we had two, there is nowhere really you can go and sit and relax and forget about it. As to the location, a positive or negative, depends if you only want to see the touristy bits or like taking a bit of a peek at some of the outside bits of the city. So, basically we've stayed in far worse, but also much better.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculately Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelbuddman
Reviews.Content: The first thing that strikes you upon arrival is the location of the hotel - near one of Rome`s university annexes and not in a row of hotels as you normally find on City holidays. As our stay was during the Roman holiday period, this actually proved to be an advantage as the surrounding area was very quiet. We are a reasonably young couple so the vicinity of the public transport network was not really a problem, however families with either young or elderly members may find the distance to the Metro station, approx quarter of a mile, a little offputting especially as you need to cross 3 main roads - if you`ve seen Roman driving you`ll understand what I mean!! For a day trip to the Vatican or any of the sights on the West of the City, the 23 bus stop is literally just around the corner and arrives every 15 mins or so. The hotel itself is a small hotel with friendly staff and nicely presented rooms containing everything you need if a little on the small side. The rooms are cleaned daily to an immaculate standard not the quick once around you sometimes find which I was personally very impressed with. The inclusive breakfast caters for all nationalities of travellers and features everything you could possibly wish for and plenty of it! Again the catering staff that set and reset the tables ( the food is self service) are very friendly and accomodating. I only have a couple of complaints, and believe me these would in no way stop me from staying at the hotel again. The services offered section of the hotel brochure in the room states that a snack bar is available however when we attempted to use the service, the hotel receptionist looked at us as if we were from Mars! It turns out that the only thing the hotel can offer is toasted sandwiches that are obviously kept in the bar freezer and they didn`t have any anyway. I know this sounds petty but when you realise that the nearest decent place to eat is a quarter of a mile walk away and it was late, this meant we had to then get ready especially - after a very long days sightseeing. The hotel states there is satellite tv in all rooms, however the channels consist of mostly italian programs, MTV and CNN news. Again a little petty but when I read sat tv, I normally expect a whole host of multi lingual channels. On the whole I would recommend this hotel to friends and family in a shot but would simply highlight a coulpe of points too.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, spotlessly clean, pity about the area it's in...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Hotel Saint Paul in Rome and I came away with almost all fond memories. The hotel suggests using the metro from Rome Termini, where most of you will end up when arriving in this great City and to be honest this really is the only way to travel in Rome especially to a hotel which is quite abit away from Rome City centre. Using the metro line b (i think) 'Laurentina', stopping at the 'Marconi' stop is the easiest, fastiest and prettiest way to arrive at the hotel. The hotel suggests getting off at the stop before 'Marconi' which is called 'Basillica Sao Paulo' - This is a major mistake because the area surrounding this metro stop is disgusting. There are alot of dodgy people that seem to constantly loiter around this station, its best avoided. Uisng the metro the hotel is about 20 mins away from the centre of Rome, thats including a 7 min walk from the metro to the hotel. The area is abit run down, its close to a major and very busy road but its grand, we had no trouble whatsover. Myself and my girlfriend walked this road at 3am a few nights during our stay coming back from Rome and out of the few people on the road, none even raised their head. Its true that there are a few ladies of the night that operate close to the Marconi metro but they keep themselves to themselves and it seems to be ignored by the Romans, it seems the norm. The hotel itself is really quite nice, the staff are awesome, they really go out of their way to help. The rooms are quite small but adequate and they are the cleanest rooms i have ever stayed at. The breakfast is brilliant, the spread includes eggs, sausage, bacon, crossiants, toast, orange, tea, fruit, cold meats, cheese, yogurt...and so on. The perfect way to start the day. I admit as we walked from Basillica Sao Paulo metro in the evening before we had even arrived at the hotel my girlfriend and I were deciding what excuse to use when cancelling but we gave it a chance and in the light of day we realised that the hotel is lovely, the area is run down but safe and the metro is a god send. Priceless advice - Dont use the Basillica Sao Paulo metro stop, use the one after which is called 'Marconi'. As you leave the metro you are facing a big busy road, cross it and head to your right. You pass stalls selling fruit and drinks, keep walking for about 7mins max and the hotel is on your left hand side..i think its about the 5th turn on the left (you'll see the flags at the side of the hotel). And ask the shop keepers. They really appreciate an attempt at using Italian as well. If your going into Rome at night, the metro stops at 11.30pm so the only way back to the hotel is by night bus which runs from 12.30pm - 5.30am in the morning. Look for Bus no. 40 or 40N (and don't worry too much about a ticket, we didnt but a ticket once, no one seemed to lol). The bus stop is along the road side on your right as you face the termini station, set off from the rest of the bus stands. Ask police that are at the station or bus drivers for help. Its advisable to ask the driver to call you when close to the Marconi stop. They are really helpful that way. All in all a lovely hotel, pity about the location but using the metro and bus you can enjoy all Rome has to offer and come back to a very nice, clean, comfortable room at the end of your day. I would stay here again but I think next time i'm gonna try and experience staying at a hotel closer to the action. Goodluck ps. get a Colloseum/Palantine Hills tour for at most 20euro...alot better than checking it out on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, a little out of town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but we did have a problem when checking in, we had specified a room with balcony which was clearly stated in our booking print out. There was a problem to get the balcony room and at this point the staff were not very friendly. After the room was sorted they were okay. The room was a nice size but the bathroom is really small - no tub only very small shower cubicle. Breakfast was good - it really got us going for the day and when we returned to our room it was always very nice and clean. I probably would not stay here again because it was too far out of the main town attractions but it only costs 1 euro for a tram ticket, at night time though the cab cost can be high and cost us nearly 70 ish euro over 4 days. We booked tickets to the Rome Opera House and found that coming back to the hotel would be pointless, its far, its costly, and we would be rushing to see the sights and get to the Opera House on time - so couldnt nip in and take quick showers and instead had to carry a change of clothes - main disadvantage to this hotel. Its more convenient to get something more central if you are sight seeing! Enjoy your visit, Rome is a very romantic city!

Reviews.Title: “Cost Effective”
Reviews.Author: ResortTravellers
Reviews.Content: If you plan to visit Rome and see all the sites and are not too interested in using hotel amenities such as the Spa or fancy restaurant then the Hotel St Paul is ideal. Fantastic staff, clean rooms and a sensible way to serve breakfast in the mornings. Some of the rooms are small and it does pay to ask the staff to look at some of the corner rooms in the hotel (as they are larger but at the same price). Some taxi drivers find it hard to find the hotel so it pays to keep the full address on hand at all times. Very close to the Metro. The staff can direct you to most of the restaurants in the vicinity. Highly recommended for those people who will be spending most of their time trekking round a city and want to crashout at a SAFE and CLEAN hotel that is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel. Shiny and new but no substance.”
Reviews.Author: ATLAS313
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 05 and had the following complaints: 1) Walls were thin as paper towels. Every door in the hallway closing my as well have been your door. I could hear TV in next room. 2) Maid service was spotty. They threw out 1/4 tube of toothpaste! Had to spend hour looking for Mom and Pop store to get toothpaste. 3) Not many good restaurants immediately nearby. 4) Electricity was out once due to wiring fixes. 5) It took them a full 20 minutes to get my Credit Card to work when checking out. 6) Staff was only moderately friendly. Positives: 1) Close to the subway. 2) Breakfast buffet was good.

Reviews.Title: “Moaning about nothing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our hotel at 9.30, 5 and a half hours after planned arrival due to a transportation strike in Italy that day! It was very dark and I felt very uneasy in the area we had to walk through to get to the hotel from the Metro! The room was not the room pictured on the web site under the package we booked but having said that it was lovely if a little cramped. The shower was fantastic but there was no shelfing so that was a bit of a pain. Around the corner we found a beautiful cheap family run tatteria. Luckily my partner speaks a bit of Italian so he did all the talking. If you are staying in this hotel I would recomend you cheak this place out. 3.20 for a liter of the house Wine! The staff couldnt have been more plesant! In the cool light of day I realised that my moaning was silly! The hotel was nice, clean and friendly. The breakfast was excellent. It was only a 5-10 minute walk to the Metro which will bring you practically anywhere you want to go in the city! It was a great stay and a great hotel but I would recomend finding out WELL IN ADVANCE where it is and how to get there BEFORE you leave!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* and transport issues...”
Reviews.Author: Doyleee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were very impressed with the pictures of the hotel, but it was a bit of a letdown... The rooms are very small and fixtures seemed 'rickety'. Staff were great though and although didn't always give clear advice, certainly tried! Breakfast was good with a wide selection although I was put off it one day when I found lots of things that looked like cat claw clippings in my eggs! The main problem with the hotel however, was travel issues... We were told buses would run all night back to the hotel but they simply did not, and we walked for miles at 2 in the morning to find the bus stop, even asking policement who didn't know anything!! Save yourself the hassle of this, and get the last metro (at 11 i think) so you don't end up spending on expensive taxis. There is virtually NOTHING to do in the vicinity of the hotel, although we did see some 'working ladies' down the road who seemed to find something... All in all not a bad hotel, it's very clean and has polite staff but not ideal if you want to do lots of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: Duchard29
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in decent hotel for the same price as this in the middle of Rome then good luck to you. This hotel, although still being partly built, i found very good and reasonable located and priced. Ok so we did also have some difficulty finding it at first but then once we knew where it was we just needed to hop on a bus into the city. Took about 15mins in total from our hotel to the centre, not bad. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and some what simple, but at least they set the standard. Staff are extremely helpful with maps and local info. All in all if you are looking for a comfortable place to stay which doesnt break the bank and a 15 mins bus ride or tube journey is not going to kill you then I fully recommend the Hotel Saint Paul. Just check on a map where it is before you arrive!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Whatever79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and the stay was okay. Not exceptional but just okay. Nice and new but out of the way.

HotelInfo.Name: Saint Paul Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vito Volterra 43, 00146 Rome, Italy
